sentences.english: That time I was a little boy, and I dropped my hatchet unwarily into the river.
sentences.chinese: 那时候我人小，不小心把手上的柴刀掉到河里。

sentences.english: Because I have people who live in Xi'an.
sentences.chinese: 因为我人是住在西安的。

sentences.english: That time I was a little bo, and I dropped m hatchet unwaril into the river.
sentences.chinese: 那时候我人小，不小心把手上的柴刀掉到河里。

sentences.english: At that time I was a little boy, and I dropped my hatchet unwarily into the river.
sentences.chinese: 那时候我人小，不小心把手上的柴刀掉到河里。

definition: ashamed/embarrassed/not having the face (to meet people)/not daring (out of shame)
lit. having face/to have prestige/to command respect/to have the nerve (e.g. to ask sth outrageous)/to have the gall/not ashamed to
interjection of wonder, shock or admiration
(modal final particle similar to 呢[ne5] or 啦[la5])
mile (unit of length equal to 1,609.344 m)/old form of modern 英里[Ying1 li3]
hey!/(interjection used to attract attention or to express surprise or disapprobation)
auntie, youngest of sisters in mother's family
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
(interjection of surprise, pain, annoyance etc)/Oh my!/Uh-oh!/Ah!/Ouch!
